snippet: Industry executives said the sprawling, decentralized system was a critical factor in the uneven supply — shortages have eased in New Jersey, for instance.
abstract: Industry experts say gas shortages in the New York metropolitan area after Hurricane Sandy are due mostly to area's sprawling, decentralized distribution system; many New York City gas stations rely on distribution terminals in Brooklyn and Queens that were damaged by the storm or lost power.
lead_paragraph: Industry executives said the sprawling, decentralized system was a critical factor in the uneven supply — shortages have eased in New Jersey, for instance.

headline.seo: Gas Shortage Persists in N.Y.C. and Nassau County
headline.main: Attention Turns to the Distribution Network for Gasoline as Shortages Persist
headline.print_headline: Attention Turns to the Distribution Network for Gasoline as Shortages Persist
